 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כָּרוֺז‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==herald== (loan-word from Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">κήρυξ</span>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">κηρύσσειν</span> ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 64, 4</sup> [[BDB#Krauss|Krauss]]<sup>ii. 296 f.</sup>; [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>GGA 1884, 1019 doubts</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] ***id.***, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (see Brook), Christian-Palestinian Aramaic [<img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">] [[BDB#Schulth|Schulth]]<sup>Lex. 97</sup>; compare [[BDB#Dalm|D]]<sup>§ 97 near the end</sup>, also [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 64, 4</sup> [[BDB#Bev|Bev]]<sup>[[Dan.5.29|Dan 5:29]]</sup> [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>§ 88</sup>); — emphatic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כָּדוֺוָא‎</span> [[Dan.3.4|Dan 3:4]].
